intro: Macrolobium unijugum, commonly known as the single-lobed macrolobium, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a single prominent lobe. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color.
